intro: Hoarea atra, commonly known as the black horehound, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers and narrow, hairy leaves. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Hoarea atra is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
